text: Question: If a user authenticates using HubSpot OAuth, does this mean their email is verified? Is that an invariant?

A query I am having problems when I want to create a new object (record) for my custom object "Orden de Venta". I have created 2 properties that have single line text formatting and these are "Número SAP" with name "numero_sap" and "Fecha de creación" with name "fecha_de_creacion".

Any suggestions please
i like serverless, aws has lambda and google has firebase
HubSpot has a serverless concept as well.  i haven’t used it yet though.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/features/serverless-functions>
what about if you have to store data in a table, and perform ETL. can't do that serverless, no?
ongoing historical data
Ok thanks for getting back to me, I also appreciate the example and will look into it further.

Hello,
I am trying to use the get contact by email api. But it is giving undefined response body when called. Here is a screenshot of my nodejs code. Can anyone please help me with this?
I think storage choice is going to depend a lot on your access patterns and throughput concerns, but dynamoDB is a popular option to pair with aws lambda, at least.
That request body looks incorrect… not sure what the UI builder is doing, but the body should probably only have one “properties” key…
Oh you are using a batch endpoint.
Still need to make sure each record has all required fields; right now each field looks like its own record.
`inputs` needs to be an array not an object
Thanks <@U01CFE2DVFT> !!!

Sorry, not sure about that one. Permissions about custom records would be where I would start looking.
